definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: The hawkish Cho believed the Separatists had attacked Glid Station.
sentences.chinese: 強硬的喬相信格利德站遭到了分裂分子的進攻。

sentences.english: Lin Manhung was rushed to answer during the questioning so her attitude seemed a little tough.
sentences.chinese: 由於林滿紅答詢時急於解釋，態度略顯強硬。

sentences.english: Miliband said the response by the European Union and NATO should be hard-headed engagement.
sentences.chinese: 米利班德說，歐盟和北約對此應該做出強硬的反應。

sentences.english: But a strong Volcker Rule just might take the cake away.
sentences.chinese: 但強硬的沃爾克法則卻會讓這個美夢落空。

sentences.english: President Clinton revived a tough provision of U. S. trade law in an attempt.
sentences.chinese: 克林頓總統重新祭出美國貿易法中強硬的一條條文。

sentences.english: Now I try to play strong but without the fouls .
sentences.chinese: 現在我正嘗試沒有犯規的強硬打法。

sentences.english: And strict rules may even harden anti-vaccination attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 嚴格的規定甚至會使得反疫苗接種的態度變得強硬。

sentences.english: The Hanna who could cry was closer to me than the Hanna who was only strong.
sentences.chinese: 對我來說，會哭的漢娜比只會強硬的漢娜更親近。

sentences.english: Taft was on us, he was just as tough on himself.
sentences.chinese: 塔夫特是對我們的，他只是作爲對自己的強硬。

sentences.english: China has promised repeatedly to take tougher measures to curb piracy.
sentences.chinese: 中國已一再承諾，會採取更強硬的措施來遏止盜版。

sentences.english: China's manifold domestic problems are another cause of China's belligerence.
sentences.chinese: 中國國內的各種問題也是其強硬姿態的誘因。

sentences.english: And here lies the explanation for much of the Kremlin's recent behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 克里姆林最近的強硬手腕，原因大多可解釋如下。

sentences.english: Essien has not always been a hardman.
sentences.chinese: 埃辛並不總是如此強硬。

sentences.english: This week, he also got tough on trade with China.
sentences.chinese: 本週，他也採取了強硬的對華貿易政策。

sentences.english: Jerry miller was a politician with strong views.
sentences.chinese: 傑裏，米勒是一個觀點鮮明，態度強硬的政治家。

sentences.english: These are slightly raised and thickened with a harder surface than the normal tissue.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是略有提高，增厚，與強硬的表面比正常組織。

definition: to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to take part in an election/to run for office
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
